physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Progressive hearing loss, positive Rinne test bilaterally, Weber test lateralized to the right, bilateral conductive hearing loss more severe on the right side, ABG of 60 dB at 250 Hz.

Normal otoscopic examination, positive Rinne test bilaterally, Weber test showed sound at the midline, audiometric testing demonstrated low-frequency ABG of 40 dB at 250 Hz and bilateral mixed hearing loss with greater loss on the left side.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, no change in air-bone gap and cVEMP thresholds were low; follow-up imaging confirmed bilateral SCD.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Decreased hearing, autophony, aural fullness, and pressure-associated and sound-associated dizziness, audiometric testing showed bilateral mixed hearing loss, with a bilateral ABG of 40 to 50 dB at 250 Hz, CT confirmed bilateral SCD.

Dizziness provoked by sound, pressure, and exercise, aural fullness, conductive hyperacusis, right-sided pulsatile tinnitus, and bilateral hearing loss more severe on the right side; audiometric testing showed a mixed hearing loss in the right ear with an ABG of 30 dB at 250, 500, and 1000 Hz.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One year after the initial operation, improvement in autophony, conductive hyperacusis, and dizziness, whereas hearing remained stable bilaterally.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dizziness and headaches provoked by sound, pressure, and exercise; normal cVEMP thresholds, audiometric testing showed a 10-dB ABG at 250 Hz on the right side.
